definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)

sentences.english: The studies didn't include pine nuts or Brazil nuts.
sentences.chinese: 这些研究没有包括松仁或者巴西坚果。

sentences.english: Heat up a skillet with some oil. Add in pine nuts and stir-fry until lightly golden.
sentences.chinese: 烧热锅入少许油，将松仁炒成金黄色，滤油。

sentences.english: Our school is on Shong-Lung Road.
Heat up a skillet with some oil. Add in pine nuts and stir-fry until lightly golden. Drain.
sentences.chinese: 烧热锅入少许油，将松仁炒成金黄色，滤油。

sentences.english: Kevin returns to the store and buys three packages of American-grown pine nuts.
sentences.chinese: 凯文返回商店买了三包美国松仁。

sentences.english: Heat up a skilletwith some oil. Add in pine nuts and stir-fry until lightly golden.
sentences.chinese: 烧热锅入少许油，将松仁炒成金黄色，滤油。

sentences.english: Heat up a  skillet with some oil. Add in pine nuts and stir-fry until lightly golden.
sentences.chinese: 烧热锅入少许油，将松仁炒成金黄色，滤油。

sentences.english: Enthusiasm for flat small people, work for the wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 刘松仁为平淡小人物，为有钱人打工。

sentences.english: Hong Kong veterans Kenneth Tsang and Damian Lau play a Chinese prosecutor and judge respectively.
sentences.chinese: 香港演员曾江和刘松仁分别饰演中国检察官和法官。

sentences.english: Clean the scallions and cut into pine-nut-sized pieces.
sentences.chinese: 青葱洗净切成松仁大小。
